source:
%%pyspark

# Read data from Azure Data Explorer table(s)
# Full Sample Code available at: https://github.com/Azure/azure-kusto-spark/blob/master/samples/src/main/python/SynapseSample.py

kustoDfDistributed  = spark.read \
    .format("com.microsoft.kusto.spark.synapse.datasource") \
    .option("spark.synapse.linkedService", "FabricKustoLS") \
    .option("kustoDatabase", "Stocks") \
    .option("kustoQuery", "KustoAirlineDataParquetQueued | take 10") \
    .option("readMode", "ForceDistributedMode") \
    .load()

display(kustoDfDistributed)
**Create a set of random data with all the datatpes**

%%spark

import scala.util.Random
import java.time.Instant
import java.util.UUID

val aDynamic = s"""{"itemid":"X-Wing-${Random.nextInt()}" , "price": ${Random.nextInt()},"quantity": ${Random.nextInt()}""" //s"""{"itemid":  , "in_stock": true,"price": ${Random.nextInt()},"quantity": 23 }"""

val data = 1 to 100000 map(x =>  (Random.nextBoolean(), Instant.now().toString() , aDynamic ,UUID.randomUUID().toString() ,Random.nextInt(),Random.nextLong(),Random.nextDouble(),Random.nextString(5),123456789.12345678910d))

val allTypesDf = spark.sqlContext.createDataFrame(data).toDF("BoolType", "DateTimeType", "DynamicType","GuidType", "IntType", "LongType","RealType","StringType","DecimalType")
//(BoolType:bool,DateTimeType:datetime,DynamicType:dynamic,GuidType:guid,IntType:int,LongType:long,RealType:real,StringType:string,DecimalType:decimal)

allTypesDf.write.format("com.microsoft.kusto.spark.synapse.datasource").option("spark.synapse.linkedService", "FabricKustoLS").option("kustoDatabase", "Stocks").option("kustoTable", "AllDataTypesTransactionalSpark33").option("tableCreateOptions","CreateIfNotExist").mode("Append").save()
//allTypesDf.write.format("com.microsoft.kusto.spark.synapse.datasource").option("spark.synapse.linkedService", "FabricKustoLS").option("kustoDatabase", "Stocks").option("kustoTable", "AllDataTypesQueuedSpark33").option("tableCreateOptions""CreateIfNotExist").option("writeMode","Queued").mode("Append").save(),
**This will not load immediately, but is a good test for the _queued_ mode**

%%pyspark

# Read data from Azure Data Explorer table(s)
# Full Sample Code available at: https://github.com/Azure/azure-kusto-spark/blob/master/samples/src/main/python/SynapseSample.py
kustoDfAllTypes  = spark.read \
    .format("com.microsoft.kusto.spark.synapse.datasource") \
    .option("spark.synapse.linkedService", "FabricKustoLS") \
    .option("kustoDatabase", "Stocks") \
    .option("kustoQuery", "TaxiData | take 100") \
    .option("readMode", "ForceDistributedMode") \
    .load()

display(kustoDfAllTypes)

%%pyspark

# Read data from Azure Data Explorer table(s)
# Full Sample Code available at: https://github.com/Azure/azure-kusto-spark/blob/master/samples/src/main/python/SynapseSample.py
transactionalModeCount  = spark.read \
    .format("com.microsoft.kusto.spark.synapse.datasource") \
    .option("spark.synapse.linkedService", "FabricKustoLS") \
    .option("kustoDatabase", "Stocks") \
    .option("kustoQuery", "AllDataTypesTransactionalSpark33 | project DiffSecs = datetime_diff('second',ingestion_time(),todatetime(DateTimeType)) | summarize  count(),min(DiffSecs),max(DiffSecs),avg(DiffSecs)") \
    .load()

display(transactionalModeCount)

%%pyspark
# Read data from Azure Data Explorer table(s)
# Full Sample Code available at: https://github.com/Azure/azure-kusto-spark/blob/master/samples/src/main/python/SynapseSample.py
queuedModeCount  = spark.read \
    .format("com.microsoft.kusto.spark.synapse.datasource") \
    .option("spark.synapse.linkedService", "FabricKustoLS") \
    .option("kustoDatabase", "Stocks") \
    .option("kustoQuery", "AllDataTypesQueuedSpark33 | project DiffSecs = datetime_diff('second',ingestion_time(),todatetime(DateTimeType)) | summarize  count(),min(DiffSecs),max(DiffSecs),avg(DiffSecs)") \
    .load()

display(queuedModeCount)
